paragraphs.text: With the 2024-25 Federal Budget just around the corner, small businesses are hoping for measures that will help them navigate ongoing economic challenges. Here's what industry leaders say should be on the government's agenda.
Small businesses are calling for meaningful tax relief and simplified compliance procedures to ease their administrative burden.
Industry groups emphasize the need for increased funding for vocational education and training programs to address skills shortages.

"The skills gap remains a critical challenge for small businesses across Australia. We need targeted support to help businesses upskill their workforce and adapt to changing market demands," says Sarah Chen, policy director at the Australian Small Business Association.
As businesses continue to digitize, there are calls for expanded incentives to support technology adoption and digital transformation initiatives.

"Small businesses need support to embrace digital technologies and compete in an increasingly online marketplace. Tax incentives for digital investments could make a real difference," notes Michael Zhang, technology consultant.
Rising energy costs continue to impact small business operations, prompting calls for targeted assistance and support for renewable energy adoption.

"The transition to renewable energy presents both challenges and opportunities for small businesses. Government support through this transition is crucial," states Emma Thompson, sustainability expert.
Industry leaders are advocating for increased mental health support for small business owners and their employees.
"The mental health toll on small business owners has been significant. We need dedicated programs and resources to support their wellbeing," advocates Dr. Rachel Williams, mental health specialist.
Businesses are seeking measures to strengthen supply chain resilience and support local manufacturing capabilities.

As the budget announcement approaches, small businesses remain hopeful that their concerns will be addressed with practical, forward-looking solutions that support growth and sustainability in the sector.
